Key Match Events: England scored their first goal through a penalty after VAR ruled against Ezri Konsa.
Cole Palmer converted the penalty and later scored again with a well-taken goal.
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored England's second goal with a swerving volley from the right-back position.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate emphasized the importance of the match as a pre-Euro 2024 warm-up.
The match provided an opportunity for fringe players like Cole Palmer and Eberechi Eze to showcase their abilities.
Post-Match Reflections: Southgate praised the performances of Cole Palmer and Eberechi Eze, highlighting their ability to play with freedom and composure.
The match was considered a useful workout for the squad, with several young players making their debuts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The St James’ Park crowd was enthusiastic, but the match itself was not a classic.
The match highlighted concerns about England's full-back options and their ability to adapt to different positions.
Others: The match was England's first at St James’ Park in 19 years.
The game served as a farewell fixture before the Euro 2024 tournament, with the next match against Iceland on June 7.
